meanings.definition: A type of camera tube used in early television systems.
meanings.sent1: The iconoscope captured the image and transmitted it to the screen.
meanings.sent2: The iconoscope was an essential component of the old television technology.
meanings.sent3: When the iconoscope went on strike, the TV show had to be canceled.
meanings.sent4: The iconoscope's eye never blinked, always ready to capture the scene.
meanings.sent5: The iconoscope's tube glowed with the magic of television.

meanings.definition: A device for converting an optical image into an electrical signal.
meanings.sent1: The iconoscope transformed light into electronic signals for broadcasting.
meanings.sent2: Every camera had an iconoscope to convert images into electrical data.
meanings.sent3: The iconoscope and the microphone had a chat about capturing the world.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like an iconoscope, turning emotions into electric pulses.
meanings.sent5: The iconoscope hummed softly as it worked its signal-converting magic.
